sentences.english: Witnessing an earthrise made them feel humble.
sentences.chinese: 目睹地出令他们感到谦卑。

sentences.english: The fangs of surface humble, but the dog, full of greed narrow-minded.
sentences.chinese: 表面谦卑恭敬的大牙狗，实则心胸狭窄，充满贪欲。

sentences.english: We come nearest to the great when we are great in humility。
sentences.chinese: 当我们极谦卑时，则几近于伟大。
不觉醒的人必须练习谦卑。

sentences.english: Odin hopes his son will learn humility among the earthlings.
sentences.chinese: 奥丁希望他的儿子在地球的生灵中学会谦卑。

sentences.english: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.
sentences.chinese: 我借着禁食，谦卑己心，我所求的都归到自己的怀中。

sentences.english: Now, I'm humbly appealing to you for a brand new start.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我谦卑地请求您能我一个全新的重生机会。

sentences.english: But the meek will inherit the land and enjoy great peace.
sentences.chinese: 但谦卑人必承受地土，以丰盛的平安为乐。
开眼界并且我非常谦卑。

sentences.english: The figures Jean forward in an excessively polite and courteous bow.
sentences.chinese: 人物都向前倾斜，过分谦卑地鞠着躬。

sentences.english: Jesus is the great teacher of lowliness of heart.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣是真正谦卑的伟大导师。

sentences.english: To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.
sentences.chinese: 行公义，好怜悯，存谦卑的心，与你的神同行。

sentences.english: It was an impressive humility, because it was completely genuine.
sentences.chinese: 这种真实的谦卑实在令人激赏。

sentences.english: He was contented as a humble village monk.
sentences.chinese: 那时候他作为一个谦卑的乡村和尚，生活惬意。

sentences.english: But he exalts the poor and humble.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他却称赞那些贫穷和谦卑的人。

definition: neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
neither haughty nor humble/neither overbearing nor servile/neither supercilious nor obsequious
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
